document.heading: Adoption of the General Welfare Services Immediate Assistance Funds Ordinance to the Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Code of Law Gwe.2

recital.text: the Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa Indians is a federally recognized Indian tribe ("Tribe") organized pursuant to the provisions of the Indian Reorganization Act of 1934, 25 U.S.C. ยง5101, et seq.; and,

the Tribal Governing Board serves as the governing body of Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa Indians pursuant to Article III, ยง 1 of the Amended Constitution and Bylaws of the Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa Indians; and
the Tribal Governing Board is empowered to "administer any funds within the control of the Band" pursuant to Article V ยง1(j); and
the Tribal Governing Board is further empowered to "regulate, by enactment of ordinances, the conduct of business within the territory of the band" pursuant to Article Vยง(n); and

the Tribal Governing Board has a long history of providing critical benefits to Tribal Members, and this financial benefit is fundamental to the sovereignty, cultural integrity, and economic well-being of the Tribe; and
the Tribe, not the IRS, are in the best position to determine the needs of its members and provide for the general welfare of tribal citizens and tribal communities; and
the Tribal Governing Board recognizes that there are emergencies and situations where Tribal Members may need immediate financial assistance; and
the enactment of GWE.2 shall allow the Tribal Governing Board to provide immediate financial assistance to Tribal Members to ensure members health and safety.

that the Tribal Governing Board hereby adopts the General Welfare Services Immediate Assistance Funds GWE.2 to support tribal members in need of immediate financial assistance to ensure members health and safety.

procedural-data.text: I, the undersigned, as Secretary/Treasurer of the Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board, hereby certify that the Tribal Governing Board is composed of seven (7) members, of whom 6 being present, constituted a quorum at a meeting thereof, duly called, convened, and held on this 23rd day of October, 2023, that the foregoing Resolution was duly adopted at said meeting by an affirmative vote of 4 members, 0 against, 1 abstaining, and that said Resolution is a lawful act of the Tribe.
Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board

container.heading: General Welfare Services Immediate Assistance Funds
General Welfare Services Immediate Assistance Funds

para.text: Tribal Governing Board members have a duty to provide for the general welfare of the tribal membership under the Amended Constitution and Bylaws of the Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa Indians.
This Policy is intended to provide guidance for Tribal Governing Board Members to promote the general welfare of the tribe when requested for immediate financial assistance.
Each Tribal Governing Board member shall have a budget line-item dedicated for the distribution of General Welfare Services funds under the direction of each individual Tribal Governing Board.
These funds are for Tribal Governing Board members to provide immediate or near immediate financial assistance to tribal members who need immediate and emergency-based financial assistance.

A Tribal Governing Board member may approve transactions from this budget line for specific services for the benefit of the tribe that fall under the guidelines of the General Welfare Exclusion GWE.1.
Benefits shall not be authorized for any sitting Tribal Governing Board members or immediate family of any Tribal Governing Board member.
Immediate family shall be defined as the child, grand-child, spouse, partner, sibling, parent, or other person living with or under the legal custody of a Tribal Governing Board member.
Benefits will be capped at $5000 per fiscal quarter. Any amounts over this limit shall require formal budget modification by the TGB.

There shall be an annual audit of each Tribal Governing Board member's spending for such near or immediate financial assistance that the Tribal Governing Board provides to tribal members. If the amount given exceeds the cap in GWE.2.1.020 (e), any such excess spending shall be deducted from the paycheck of the Tribal Governing Board member until such overage is recouped by the Tribe. The Tribal Governing Board hereby authorizes such deductions and agrees to be personally liable for such overage that causes the deduction.
The Accounting Department shall provide quarterly updates and an accounting to the Chairman on each TGB members compliance with the benefits cap.
The General Welfare Services budget line-item for Tribal Governing Board Members shall be allocated under the normal tribal budget formulation.
Funds for this General Welfare Services line-items shall be funded from the Tribe's general fund.
A transaction for the purposes of this ordinance shall be a request for immediate financial assistance communicated to the individual Tribal Governing Board member.
The Tribal Governing Board member shall have the authority to approve or deny the request based upon the member's immediate needs. A denied request is not subject to an appeal.

General Welfare Services transactions requested by an individual Tribal Governing Board member must be authorized by the governing board member under their general welfare services line-item. Any transactions authorized on a weekday, holiday or any day where the government offices are not open for business shall be processed on the following business day.

Any request under this section must be established under the exigent standards, the Tribal Governing Board member will advise the requestee of existing tribal government services to ensure that tribal resources are considered.
A Tribal Governing Board member may authorize a General Welfare Services transaction through designated employee and/or the Accounting Department.
An approved request will be processed consistent with the fiscal policies of the tribe and under the authority of this ordinance.
The Tribal sf employee processing the authorization shall complete the necessary forms for the transaction, including the accounts payable voucher, and the required general welfare documentation.
All documents shall be retained for audit and tax reporting purposes.
Transactions that exceed the general welfare services line item shall not be processed and considered to be denied.
